title.native: 断裁分離のクライムエッジ

description: Haimura Kiri is a seemingly ordinary boy with one slight problem: he is obsessed with cutting other people's hair. One day he meets Mushiyanokouji Iwai, the "Hair Queen" who cannot cut her hair because of an inherited curse. Kiri finds out that his scissor, "Dansai Bunri no Crime Edge" is the only thing that can cut them. But little did he know that their meeting sparked the start of an old murder game to kill the "Hair Queen" using the cursed killing tools, the "Killing Goods." Can Kiri protect Iwai from the Killing Goods Owners? Let the game begin!

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Criminal Organization
tags.description: Prominently features a group of people who commit crimes for illicit or violent purposes.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Zombie
tags.description: Prominently features reanimated corpses which often prey on live humans and turn them into zombies.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Curses
tags.description: Features a character, object or area that has been cursed, usually by a malevolent supernatural force.

node.description: Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). He is a member of the Writers Guild of Japan.

[Profile (Peerless Gerbera)](http://pg-wcf.co.jp/profile/04/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/koiwai-kotori/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/koiwai_kotori) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UClDfVHJxrsGTq61MJp55s3Q) | [ASMR Website](https://www.kotoneiro.com/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kotori_Koiwai) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/小岩井ことり)

Kotori Koiwai is a Japanese voice actress, songwriter, and lyricist from Kyoto. She is affiliated with Peerless Gerbera.

__Non-anime roles:__
• Suzutsuki (Azur Lane)
• Yun Jin (Genshin Impact)
• Rin (Princess Connect Re:Dive)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/aimi_sound) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aimin_official/)

A voice actor and musician, notably the lead vocalist and guitarist of [Poppin'Party](https://anilist.co/staff/153185/PoppinParty). Aimi had dreamed of becoming a singer ever since she was young. She initially only aspired to become a singer, but she became interested in voice acting after becoming familiar with the anime series Macross Frontier, where she was impressed at how the series was able to combine music and animation in its storytelling. 

In order to make her dream come true, she participated in various contests, such as the “Best of Singer Contest National Championship 2008”, which she made into the Finals but lost. She was one of 3rd ANIMAX Anison Grand Prix Finalists with Sayaka Sasaki in 2009, and was a winner of the Osaka block. On February 6th, 2010, she made it to the finals of the “Aim for Ellie! Milky Holmes Seiyuu Audition”, a seiyuu audition tour hosted by DWANGO Creative School, but lost the role to Mikoi Sasaki. However, she did make her debut as a seiyuu in the Milky Holmes anime.

Aimi was the guitarist of a girls' band in high school and self-taught, but quit playing after graduating. She picked it up back in 2014 and used it to perform during her THE iDOLM@STER Million Live! live performances as Julia. Aimi is the influence and where Kidani Takaaki, the president of Bushiroad, got his idea for the BanG Dream! franchise from - after seeing Aimi playing the guitar during THE IDOLM@STER M@STERS OF IDOL WORLD!! 2014. 

She used her full name for her voice actress career and Aimi (愛美) for her singer career, but she started to use the latter for both since December 2013.

(Source: BanG Dream! Wikia)

**Non-Anime Roles**:
- Brünhilde - Azur Lane (VG)
- Mica - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Serval - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)
- Yan - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Cristallo - Reverse: 1999 (VG)
He passed away from undisclosed causes in January 2020.
In March 2010, she graduated from Tokyo Animation College.

__[Blog (JP)](http://unisen.blog.shinobi.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Yuriko_m)__

__Graduated:__ Ferris University

__Yuriko Mutou__, better known as Yuriko Mori, is a Japanese lyricist.

__[Blog (JP)](http://ameblo.jp/sira10/)__

__Birthplace:__ Toride City, Ibaraki Prefecture, Japan

__Yuusuke Shirato__ is a Japanese arranger, composer, lyricist and musician.

__[Profile (Melonest)](http://melonest.com/creators/kusano.html)__

__Yoshihiro Kusano__ is a Japanese guitarist, composer and arranger.

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/yuji.hagiwara.18) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yu-pan)

Yuuji Hagiwara is a Japanese arranger and composer, formerly affiliated with Bond&Co.

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/yuji.hagiwara.18) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yu-pan)

Yuuji Hagiwara is a Japanese arranger and composer, formerly affiliated with Bond&Co.
Megumi Sena is a Japanese lyricist.

[Twitter (inactive)](https://twitter.com/yurikarikoetama)

Voice actress duo comprised of [Yurika Endou](https://anilist.co/staff/118480/Yurika-Endou) and [Karin Takahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/125920/Karin-Takahashi). They formed in 2013 and stopped activities in 2015.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%89%A7%E9%87%8E%E4%BF%A1%E5%8D%9A) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nobuhiromakino/) | [Official Website](https://mackey-mackeyboard.com/)

Nobuhiro Makino was a Japanese arranger, composer, keyboardist and music producer. [Yui Makino](https://anilist.co/staff/95089/Yui-Makino) is his daughter.
